description: BOROUGH OF WEST CHESTER WEST CHESTER, PENNSYLVANIA Sealed bids will be received through PennBidâ„¢ by the Borough of West Chester for Greenfield Park Stormwater Improvements, until 10:00 AM, prevailing time, on the 6th day of June 2022, at which time they will be publicly read at the Borough of West Chester Building, 401 East Gay Street, West Chester PA 19380. All documents and solicitations details are available online anytime at no cost at PennBidâ„¢ (www.pennbid.procureware.com). Note, PennBIDTM assesses a fee to the bidder who is issued the award. Click on the â€œSolicitationsâ€ and â€œViewâ€ tabs. Each bid must be accompanied by a certified check or bid bond payable to the Owner in an amount of not less than ten percent (10%) of the bid or bids. Only bonds from companies licensed to do business in the State where the Owner is located will be accepted and the bond shall so state same. This project is subject to prevailing wage rates in accordance with Pennsylvania Department of Labor and Industry. The project involves the installation of rain gardens, stormwater improvements, and paving. Bids must be submitted unconditionally. No bidder may withdraw bid within SIXTY (60) days after the scheduled closing time for receipt of bids. The Owner reserves the right to waive any informalities, or to reject any or all bids. There will be a non-mandatory Pre-Bid Meeting on May 26, 2022 at 1:00 PM, at 625 South Franklin Street, West Chester, PA 19382. This meeting is NOT required but prospective bidders are strongly encouraged to attend.

Ms. Maureen Jampo Board Secretary

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Water Meter Read System Upgrade Project
description: NOTICE Hazleton City Authority - Water Department 400 East Arthur Gardner Parkway Hazleton, PA 18201 Scot, Burkhardt, Director of Operations Mr. Joseph Zeller, III Phone (570) 454-2401 Chairman Fax (570) 454-9671 Public Bid / RFP Opening: Date: Tuesday, June 7, 2022 Time: Bid closes at 4:00 P.M. Location: R.L. Zientek Administration Building Office 400 East Arthur Gardner Parkway Hazleton, PA 18201 Notice is hereby given that the HAZLETON CITY AUTHORITY - WATER DEPARTMENT, City of Hazleton, Luzerne County, Pennsylvania, will receive sealed bids or proposals for the 2022 Fixed base Water Meter Read System Upgrade Project. ln general, the scope of work includes a complete design-build proposal to upgrade the existing HCA Badger drive by radio water meter read system to a high breed system incorporating a fixed base/drive by system. Sealed bids or proposals will be received until 4:00 PM prevailing time, on Tuesday, June 7, 2022, and all such received bids will be publicly opened and read aloud at during the 6:30 PM, Tuesday, June 7, 2022 HCA Board Meeting at the Hazleton City Authority's R.L.zientek Administration Building office. All prospective bidders must reg ister to obtain access to Contract and Bidding Documents. Bidder registration forms must be downloaded directly at no cost from the HCA web site www.hcawater.org and emailed to HCA at info@hcawater.org Sets of the Contract Documents, including applicable drawings and specifications pertaining to such bids are available at no cost once registered as a bidder. No paper copies of documents will be provided. A certified check or bid bond drawn to the order of the Hazleton City Authority - Water Department in an amount equal to ten percent (10%) of the bid must be submitted with each proposal as bid security and receivedat the Authority's Office with all other required bid documents prior to the Bid Opening. Bidders shall comply with all procedures and requirements of the Contract Documents. The HCA encourage DBEs, including MBEs and WBES, to submit a bid proposal. All Prime and subcontractors shall make the required good faith efforts when subcontracting and shall provide all documents to substantiate their search prior to award. Prior to the award of any contract, the successful bidder shall furnish to the Owner Certificates of Insurance. Performance Bond, Labor and Material Payment Bond, American Steel Certifications, DBE/WBE Compliance Documents, and any other items as required by the Contract Documents. A satisfactory surety shall execute all bonds. Bidders on all work will be required to comply with the Pennsylvania Human Relations Act No. 222. The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Department of Labor and Industry and Federal Prevailing minimum Davis Bacon Wage Determinations, which are included as, part of the contract Documents. All required wage rates for this project and shall govern all work under this Contract. The Hazleton City Authority - Water Department is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Except as otherwise provided by law, no Bidder may withdraw a bid within sixty (60) consecutive calendar days after the actual date of the bid opening or one hundred twenty (120) consecutive calendar days if the award is delayed by a required approval of another governmental agency, the sale of bonds, or the award of a grant or grants. The Hazleton City Authority is a Pennsylvania Municipal Authority and subject to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act. All prospective bidders shall execute a waiver of the Application of the Uniform Electronic Transactions Act, 73 P.S. ^2260.101 et seq., and the Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act, 15 U.S.C.S. ^7001 et seq. The Hazleton City Authority - Water Department hereby reserves the right in its discretion, which is understood and agreed to by all bidders, to reject any and all bids submitted, and also reserves the right to waive any irregularities, omissions, mistakes, or informality in the Bidding Process. The Bid, if awarded, will be awarded at the sole discretion of the Authority at the lowest total cost to the best responsive and responsible Bidder based on a final review work to be awarded as selected by the Owner. All bidders must show adequate knowledge, experience and past projects in similar size and complexity. Hazleton City Authority - Water Department Joseph Zeller, lll Chairman

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Storm Sewer Replacement Project
description: NOTICE TO BIDDERS Sealed bids for the below project will be received by Chalfont Borough, hereinafter generally referred to as the Borough, on June 7, 2022 until 10:00 AM (Prevailing Time) via the PennBID Electronic Bid Management System and opened shortly thereafter. All documents and solicitation details will be available on or after May 9, 2022 at https://pennbid.procureware.com. Bidders must register (a free process), then click on the "Solicitations," then "View" tabs. STORM SEWER REPLACEMENT PROJECT IN CHALFONT BOROUGH, BUCKS COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA CONTRACT NO. 4409 The project involves improvements to existing storm drainage facilities within Chalfont Borough's Lindenfield Area. The work to be performed under this Contract includes the replacement of approximately 706 linear feet of 15" CMP with 15" HDPE; the replacement of 77 linear feet of 18" CMP with 18" HDPE; the replacement of 361 linear feet of 24" CMP with 24" HDPE; the replacement of 652 linear feet of 30" CMP with 30" HDPE; the replacement of 259 linear feet of 33" CMP with 33" HDPE; the replacement of 206 linear feet of 42" CMP with 42" HDPE; remove and replace 25 Type C inlet top units and 2 Type M inlet top units; associated curb and sidewalk replacement; 8 curb ramp replacements; and the mill and overlay of approximately 13,550 SY of roadways at the Lindenfield area and along Chestnut Street in the Borough. All construction will occur within Borough roads and rights-of-way and easement areas and will involve restoration of pavement and unimproved areas, and provision for all erosion and sedimentation control. All bids must include lump sum or unit prices to be considered for award by the Borough at their option after review of the bid amounts. Bids must be accompanied by a certified check, bank draft or bid bond issued by a surety company licensed to conduct business in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, in the amount of at least ten percent (10%) of the total Bid Amount made payable to the Borough. The bidder's attention is called to the fact that the Pennsylvania Prevailing Wage Act and the Pennsylvania Public Works Employment Verification Act apply to this Contract, if the estimated cost of the project is in excess of $25,000. The successful bidder shall pay no less than the wage rates determined for the project area as set forth in the Contract Documents. The successful bidder must also ensure that employees, subcontractors and applicants for employment are (a) not discriminated against because of their race, color, religion, sex or national origin, or on any other basis on which discrimination is prohibited by any applicable federal, state or local laws and (b) legally authorized to work in the United States. The successful bidder will be required to furnish separate bonds with corporate surety issued by companies authorized to do business in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania on the prescribed forms dated the date of the Contract, or separate Federal or Commonwealth chartered lending institution irrevocable letters of credit in a form accepted and approved by the Borough, or separate restrictive or escrow accounts with such lending institutions pursuant to an escrow agreement accepted and approved by the Borough, each equal to one hundred percent (100%) of the Contract amount, to secure (a) the faithful performance and maintenance of the Contract; and (b) the prompt payment of materials and labor. The project is partially funded through a PA Small Water and Sewer Grant from the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Commonwealth Financing Authority, requiring Contract compliance with the Grant. Bidders are advised that all applicable provisions of the Occupational Safety and Health Act (Public Law 91-596, dated December 29, 1970, latest revision) shall be strictly adhered to on this project. Bids must be accompanied by a completed Bid Form, Bidder's Qualification Statement, electronic copy of Bid Bond, executed Non-Collusion Affidavit and Public Works Verification Form as set forth in the Contract Documents. Failure to submit an Affidavit with the bid proposal will result in disqualification of the bid. Award of Contract, if a contract be awarded, will be to the lowest responsible bidder, but the Borough reserves the unqualified right to reject any or all bids and to waive any informalities. The Borough also reserves the right to delete any "item" or portion of an "item" contained in the Contract at its discretion, once bids are received. Prior to awarding the Contract, bids may be held by the Borough for a period not to exceed sixty (60) days from the date of the bid opening for the purpose of reviewing the bids and investigating the qualifications of bidders. During this period, no bid may be withdrawn. Shawn Curran Borough Manager

description: ADVERTISEMENT FOR BID Sealed bids will be received online by Willistown Township via PennBid until 11:00 A.M. prevailing time, on Tuesday, June 7, 2022, at which time they will be opened online and posted via PennBid for: FAIRVIEW ROAD SANITARY SEWER REPAIRS CONTRACT 22-S1 The project consists of removing and replacing 972 feet of sanitary sewer main and appurtenances. No bid may be withdrawn within sixty (60) days of the bid opening date. The Willistown Township reserves the right to reject all bids and waive any bidding informalities. Sally Slook, Township Manager Willistown Township

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Water Filtration Plants SCADA System Project
description: ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS Separate sealed bids will be received, in duplicate by the Municipal Authority of the Township of Blythe, Blythe Township, Schuylkill County, Pennsylvania until 1:00 P.M. prevailing time, on June 8, 2022, at the Blythe Township Municipal Authority office for the Water Filtration Plants SCADA System Project. Bids should be mailed, or hand delivered to the office of Blythe Township Municipal Authority, 375 Valley Street, New Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 17959. Bids will be opened and read aloud at 1:00 P.M. on June 8, 2022. Bids will be reviewed and recommended for award to the lowest qualified Bidder at the Public Meeting of Blythe Township Municipal Authority at their regularly scheduled meeting. The consideration of the apparent low bidder will be at the regularly scheduled Authority meeting to be held at 6:00 P.M. prevailing time on June 9, 2022. The project generally consists of removing existing, furnishing, and installing new process instrumentation within three (3) existing water filtration plants (Crystal Run WFP, Silver Creek WFP, and Moss Glen WFP) including running conduit, power, and signal wire to existing and new PLC panels. Instrumentation includes but is not limited to flowmeters, turbidimeters, chemical probes, sensors and analyzers, and level sensors used in the potable water treatment process. A MANDATORY pre-bid conference will be held on May 25, 2022, at 9:00 A.M. beginning at the office of Blythe Township Municipal Authority, 375 Valley Street, New Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 17959. All three water filtration plants will subsequently be visited. Directions will be provided at the meeting. Anticipate 2 hours per plant. All BIDDERS who will be submitting bids to the Authority must register and purchase a complete set of Bid Documents from Systems Design Engineering, Inc. Copies of the Bid Documents shall be obtained and can be examined at the office of Systems Design Engineering, Inc., 1032 James Drive, Leesport, Pennsylvania 19533. Cost of a Bid Document set is fifty ($50.00) dollars for digital copy. No hard copies will be available. Checks should be payable to Systems Design Engineering, Inc. NO refunds will be given. All bids are to be submitted on the Bid Form contained in the Contract Documents. Each Bid must be accompanied by a Certified Check or Surety Company's Bid Bond on the form provided in the Bid Documents, naming as payee or Obligee, The Municipal Authority of the Township of Blythe, Schuylkill County in the amount of ten (10%) percent of the total bid submitted. The Surety Company must be acceptable to the Authority. Any BID received after the time and date specified will not be considered. No bid may be withdrawn for a period of sixty (60) days after the above specified date for receiving, opening, and reading of Bids, except as specifically provided by law. All Contracts exceeding $10,000.00 shall be performed in compliance with Executive Order 11246, entitled, "Equal Employment Opportunity", as amended by Executive Order 11375 and as supplemented in Department of Labor regulations (41 CFR Part 60). In addition, all Contractors shall comply with the "Nondiscrimination/Sexual Harassment Clause" as required by Pennsylvania Executive Order 2016-05. The successful bidder (Contractor) will be required to execute the Agreement and to furnish a "Performance Bond" and "Payment Bond" all on the respective forms provided in the Contract Documents. The Contractor also will be required to furnish evidence of insurance coverage as required by the Contract Documents. The wages paid on this project will be subject to the Pennsylvania Prevailing Wage Act approved August 15, 1961, P.L. 987 as amended and supplemented. The Pennsylvania Human Relations Act of 1955, P.L. 744, No. 222, as amended June 25, 1997 by Act 34 of 1997, 43 P.S. ^^ 951-963, shall apply to this contract. Attention is called to the fact that not less than the minimum salaries and wages as set forth in the contract documents must be paid on this project, and that employees and applicants for employment shall not be discriminated against because of their race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, or handicap. The Bidder and all subcontractors must be qualified for the type of project work specified in order to bid the project, and prequalifications must be submitted by the Bidder and all subcontractors. The qualification documentation listed in Article 3 in the Instructions to Bidders must be submitted with the bid. Bidders should refer to provisions of federal and state statutes, rules and regulations dealing with prevention of environmental pollution and the preservation of public, natural resources that affect the project. The Municipal Authority of the Township of Blythe reserves the right to waive any informalities in, or to reject any or all Bids, and to delete any item or portion of an item without affecting the bids on the remaining items or portion of items. The above invitation to Bidders is made for the benefit of the Municipal Authority of the Township of Blythe, Blythe Township, Schuylkill County, and no rights shall be deemed to accrue to any person making a Bid by reason of the submission of any bid hereunder or by waiver or non-enforcement of any provision of requirement of this invitation. Any BID may be withdrawn prior to the above scheduled time for the opening of BIDS or authorized postponement thereof. The award of the Contract and the issuance of Notice to Proceed shall be contingent upon the approval of the Performance Bond, Payment Bond, Agreement, and the Certificates of Insurance. Municipal Authority of the Township of Blythe, Schuylkill County Justin DeAngelo, General Manager

description: NOTICE Sealed bids will be received by Worcester Township (â€œTownship), until 1pm on June 8, 2022 via PennBid Electronic Document and Bid Management Program. The project will include construction of reinforced concrete footings and floor slab, exposed and buried piping and piping modifications, new electrical work in conjunction with new building, and all related sitework. Township also reserves right to delete any â€œitemâ€ or portion of an â€œitemâ€ contained in the Contract at its discretion, once bids are received. Prior to awarding the Contract, bids may be held by Township for a period not to exceed 60 days from date of bid opening for purpose of reviewing bids and investigating qualifications of bidders. During this period, no bid may be withdrawn. Tommy Ryan, Township Manager, Worcester Township

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Sanitary Sewer Lateral Cleanout Installation
description: NOTICE TO BIDDERS Sealed bids will be received by the Montgomery Township Municipal Sewer Authority, hereinafter generally referred to as the Authority, on June 7, 2022 until 10:00 AM (Prevailing Time) via the PennBID Electronic Bid Management System and opened shortly thereafter. All documents and solicitation details are available on or after May 10, 2022 at https://pennbid.procureware.com. Bidders must register (a free process), then click on the â€œSolicitations,â€ then â€œViewâ€ tabs. 2022 BASIN â€œBâ€ SANITARY SEWER LATERAL CLEANOUT INSTALLATION â€“ PHASE 2 CONTRACT NO. 8409-9B.2 MONTGOMERY TOWNSHIP MUNICIPAL SEWER AUTHORITY MONTGOMERY TOWNSHIP, MONTGOMERY COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA The work to be performed under this Contract generally consists of the installation of cleanouts on designated sewer laterals of the Authorityâ€™s sanitary sewage collection/conveyance system located within Montgomery Township. Specifically, the project includes the installation of 69 new cleanouts on existing sanitary sewer laterals. Bids must be accompanied by a certified check, bank draft or bid bond issued by a surety company licensed to conduct business in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, in the amount of at least ten percent (10%) of the total price bid made payable to the Authority. Shannon Q. Drosnock Executive Director Montgomery Township Municipal Sewer Authority

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Sanitary Sewer System Repairs
description: ADVERTISEMENT FOR BID Westtown Township will receive sealed bids online via PennBid for Contract 22-S1 - 2022 Sanitary Sewer System Repairs until 11:00 a.m. prevailing time, on Thursday, June 9, 2022, at which time they will be opened online and posted via PennBid. The project involves repairs of cracks, holes, pipe joints and lateral connections at 28 locations in the Townshipâ€™s sewer system. All documents and details are available at PennBid - www.pennbid.net Each bid must be accompanied by a certified check drawn to the order of Westtown Township, or a Bid Bond in favor of Westtown Township in the amount of 10% of the bid price. Said check or bond shall be subject to the conditions provided in the Instructions to Bidders. The work in connection with this project constitutes a Public Works by a Public Body under Pennsylvania Prevailing Wage Act. Bidders are advised that prevailing minimum wage rates, promulgated by the Pennsylvania Secretary of Labor, must be paid to workmen employed on this project. No bid may be withdrawn within sixty (60) days of the date of the bid opening. The Westtown Township reserves the right to reject any and all bids and to waive any bidding informalities. Jon Altshul, Township Manager Westtown Township

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Pump Station Control Systems
description: ADVERTISEMENT FOR BID Sealed bids will be received online via PennBid by West Brandywine Township Municipal Authority at Carroll Engineering Corporation, 949 Easton Road, Warrington, PA 18976 until 10:00 A.M. prevailing time, on Wednesday, June 15, 2022 at which time they will be opened online and posted via PennBid for: CONTRACT 22-1 PUMP STATION CONTROL SYSTEMS The project consists of the replacing the controls systems at three pump stations and regearing the pumps at the stations to operate at a constant speed. All documents and details are available at PennBid â€“ https://pennbid.procureware.com Each bid must be accompanied by a certified check drawn to the order of West Brandywine Township Municipal Authority, or a Bid Bond in favor of West Brandywine Township Municipal Authority in the amount of 10% of the bid price. Said check or bond shall be subject to the conditions provided in the Instructions to Bidders. The work in connection with this project constitutes a Public Works by a Public Body under Pennsylvania Prevailing Wage Act. Bidders are advised that prevailing minimum wage rates, promulgated by the Pennsylvania Secretary of Labor, must be paid to workmen employed on this project. A Pre-bid Conference will be held at the Beaver Creek Pump Station, 210 Swinehart Road, Coatesville, PA 19320 at the date and time indicated in Article 5 of the Instructions to Bidders provided on PennBid. No bid may be withdrawn within sixty (60) days of the date of the bid opening. The West Brandywine Township Municipal Authority reserves the right to reject any and all bids and to waive any bidding informalities. Anita Ferenz, Administrator West Brandywine Township Municipal Authority

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Sanitary Sewer Replacement Project
description: The Municipal Authority of Ralpho Township will receive sealed bids for the Spruce & West Center Street Sanitary Sewer Replacement Project at the office of the Authority until 10 a.m., prevailing time on June 16, 2022. Bids will then be opened and publicly read aloud. The location of the work is in the area of the intersection of Spruce Street and S.R. 487 to West Center Street as well a section 0.5 miles down West Center Street in Ralpho Township, Northumberland County, PA. Work generally consists of the following; removal and replacement of approximately 3,300 linear feet of sanitary sewer gravity main, manholes and service laterals along with associated restoration of Township and State roads, stream relocation and bank stabilization work. Copies of the Contract Documents may be obtained at the office of the Engineer; KPI Technology, 200 South Second Street, Sunbury, PA (570-286-3176) for a non-refundable fee of $100.00 or examined free of charge at the Office of the Engineer and/or Authority. A pre-bid conference will be held at 10:00 AM on May 26, 2022 at the office of the Authority located at 206 South Market Street, Elysburg, PA 17824. Attendance at this meeting is not mandatory but greatly encouraged. No bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a certified check or Bid Bond in an amount equal to at least ten percent (10%) of the total bid. The Bid Security shall be made payable to the Municipal Authority of Ralpho Township, County of Northumberland, Pennsylvania. All Bid Bonds must be accompanied by a Power of Attorney or suitable letter of commitment from a licensed surety company as described in the Instructions to Bidders and Specifications. Bids may be held by the OWNER for up to 60 days from the date of bid opening for the purpose of reviewing the bids and investigating the qualifications of bidders prior to awarding the contract. The contract for work under this Bid will obligate the Contractor, and any Subcontractors, not to discriminate in employment practices and to comply with the Pennsylvania Prevailing Wage Act and any other such Federal and State requirements presented in bid documents. The Owner reserves the right, at its option, to reject any or all bids, to waive any informalities, irregularities, defects, errors or omissions in any or all Bid Proposals, as the Owner may deem to be in its best interest. BY ORDER OF THE MUNICIPAL AUTHORITY OF RALPHO TOWNSHIP, COUNTY OF NORTHUMBERLAND, PENNSYLVANIA

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) FY22 Lake Marion Providence Reach Water Line
description: DESCRIPTlON OF WORK: This project includes furnishing, installing, and placing into successful operation approximately 6,280 LF of 12-inch and 14-inch diameter water main pipe, master meter station, and all associated work. The contract includes all pipe, valves, appurtenances, roadway bores, horizontally directionally drilled pipe, backfill, compaction, testing, quality control, safety, and all other related work required to place the project into successful operation. This contract will be a portion of the Lake Marion Regional Water System with portions owned, operated, and maintained by both Santee Cooper and Orangeburg County. The Contractor will be responsible for coordinating local utility owners, property owners, Lake Marion Water Treatment Plant personnel, and Orangeburg County. Magnitude of Work: $1,000,000.00 TO $5,000,000.00 The North American Industry Classification System Code (NAICS) is: 237110, Water and Sewer Line Related Structures with a SBA Business Size $39.5 million. SMALL BUSINESS SET-ASIDE: Total 100% Small Business Set-Aside. Solicitation is hereby posted and active as of 25 April 2022.Amendment posted to correct the Archive date. Proposal due date has not changed it is still 05/25/2022 at 13:00 est. Adminstrative Modification is hereby posted and active as of 05/04/2202.The purpose of this amendment is to extend the Due Date to 09 June 2022 and update the Cost Breakdown Sheet. Amendment 0001 is hereby posted on 20 May 2022. Amendment A0002 is POSTED TO UPDATE THE PROPOSAL DUE DATE IN SAM.GOV AND IS hereby posted on 20 May 2022. PROPOSALS DUE 6.9.2022 13:00 hrs. Amendment A0003 is POSTED TO UPDATE THE PROPOSAL TIME DUE THE CORRECT TIME IS 1300 HRS EASTERN DAYLIGHT TIME and BID OPENING IS 1400HRS EASTERN DAYLIGHT TIME, this A0003 Amendment is hereby posted on 3 June 2022. *Visit 'https://piee.eb.mil/sol/xhtml/unauth/search/oppMgmtLink.xhtml?solNo=W912HP22R0004' to obtain more details.*

category_id: Infrastructure: Water, Sewer, Power, Gas, Utilities Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Remove and Replace Asphalt Base Wide
description: The 169th Fighter Wing requires contractor to perform maintenance basewide for the repair of asphalt around various buildings including buildings 200, 210, 212, 253, 258, 984, 1046, and 1147. Project includes but is not limited to grading, compacted subgrade and base course, asphalt removal and placement, striping, and parking bumpers.? Contractor will furnish all necessary equipment, labor, MSDS?s, materials, tools, and transportation needed to accomplish the project. Work will be accomplished at McEntire Joint National Guard Base, Eastover, South Carolina.? All information and quantities need to be verified by the contractor.? This will be completed to standards in accordance with AF guidance while rectifying existing associated issues.? All repairs shall be in accordance with applicable Unified Facility Criteria, ANG and Air Force Engineering Technical Letters, and all other regulator and code requirements. Please draw your attention to Provision 52.236-27 Site Visit, to see details about upcoming site visit.
